data.title: THIS WAS MY LIFE. Palmer, Lilli
data.meta_description: Ultramar Publishing. Madrid, 1976. Softcover binding. Condition Good. Back cover a little rubbed. Pages 288. ISBN 8473860675. Ref. 1D2000031. With humor and simplicity, rare qualities in the autobiographies of theater people, Lilli Palmer tells of her life, her first years as a "good fat girl" in Berlin, and her transformation into a beautiful woman, her escape from Nazi Germany, which He takes her to Paris, where she works as a cabaret singer in an ill-fated attempt to make a living. But Alexander Korda discovers her and from that moment on they parade: her stormy marriage with Rex Harrison, her triumphs on Broadway, her life in Hollywood and her final return to Germany, where she marries the Argentine Carlos Thompson. Remarkable and truthful anecdotes about Ronald Colman, Greta Arbo, Noel Coward, Clarck Gable, Laurence Olivier, Gary Cooper, and many other stars of the film and art world, appear in this fascinating and sincere autobiography, almost a confession.

But Alexander Korda discovers her and from that moment on they parade: her stormy marriage with Rex Harrison, her triumphs on Broadway, her life in Hollywood and her final return to Germany, where she marries the Argentine Carlos Thompson. Remarkable and truthful anecdotes about Ronald Colman, Greta Arbo, Noel Coward, Clarck Gable, Laurence Olivier, Gary Cooper, and many other stars of the film and art world, appear in this fascinating and sincere autobiography, almost a confession.
